title: mikeywith
author: mikeywith
content: On their Twitter, Bitmain announced a new gift, a 13% enhancement in efficiency for the S19 pro, of course, Christmas is not here yet and you have to wait till the 20th of Dec to get it.It would be fun to watch how the new update will perform, is it going to be 25.5w/th at the same default hashrate of 100-110th? or something like the custom firmware out there, maybe 60-70th to get to that 25w/th mark? if it's really 2500w/100th that would be a huge improvement, and of course, fuel for mining difficulty.

comments.author: Artemis3
comments.body: Remember when the S9 asicboost capable chips were in the market for a whole two years without asicboost support in the firmware? If it is 64TH someone already did 20.9 J/T with Braiins OS+.

comments.author: danbel79
comments.body: The new miner.. has better dissipation and the BM1362AK chip.. should be more efficient..The asic is smaller than the previous BM1362AC

comments.author: altair_tech
comments.body: Looks like Bitmain might have accidentally released the new firmware for S19 Hydro models, a few days early. The currently listed firmware for hydro models on their firmware page is from Dec 15th, 2022. https://imgur.com/a/0vVM401I don't have any hydros, but those who do might be able to provide more details on efficiency improvements.

comments.author: danbel79
comments.body: The developers of public firmwares... live from that... they earn up to 3% of the hashrate worked... it seems that this time bitmain once again beat them to it!! better efficiency in their new chips.. with their firmware in their own way.. Voltage and frequency!!

comments.author: PopoJeff
comments.body: Saw the Twitter last night.  Just signed into Bitmain and only firmware I'm seeing is from 12/15 for the Hydro.

comments.author: mikeywith
comments.body: Quote from: danbel79 on December 17, 2022, 10:47:25 PMThe developers of public firmwares... live from that... they earn up to 3% of the hashrate worked... it seems that this time bitmain once again beat them to it!! better efficiency in their new chips.. with their firmware in their own way.. Voltage and frequency!!I wouldn't say they beat the aftermarket firmware, the report I saw shows the best efficiency at 25w/th with about 20% loss in the total hashrate, Artemis3 mentioned 20w/th, I am sure Vnish folks would probably report similar numbers, of course, you still need to consider the dev fees you pay for those two versions, but auto-tunning will always beat static figures in term of efficiency.IMO, S19 pro is pretty much effienct by default, the efficiency gains will affect the total earnings for most people with low power rates, a 20% loss in hashrate or even 10% is no joke, it will be good for those who pay higher rates, some serious maths need to do before choosing whether to go for the upgrade or not, the same math that needs to be done when choosing to go custom or not, different things work differently for different people.Quote from: PopoJeff on December 20, 2022, 08:21:32 PMSaw the Twitter last night.  Just signed into Bitmain and only firmware I'm seeing is from 12/15 for the Hydro.There is no need to sign in, just go to https://shop.bitmain.com/support/download select S19 pro or S19j pro, the latest firmware has (Support S19 Pro low power mode) in it with publish date 19-12-2022.

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: Quote from: PopoJeff on December 20, 2022, 08:21:32 PMSaw the Twitter last night.  Just signed into Bitmain and only firmware I'm seeing is from 12/15 for the Hydro.it is around click on the hydro play with it and this will showthis is a direct link for s19prohttps://file12.bitmain.com/shop-product-s3/firmware/9c330d28-9950-474d-879b-7f8f8e84d3d5/2022/12/19/21/Antminer-S19-Pro-merge-release-20221214064258.bmuthis is a direct link for older s19pro you may need to this one below then the one abovehttps://file12.bitmain.com/shop-product-s3/firmware/b836b562-cc0d-467b-b1e7-de22db017a16/2021/12/16/14/Antminer-S19-Pro-release-202111161920.bmu

comments.author: PopoJeff
comments.body: Thanks for the information (both you above).  For some reason, that drop down box wasn't populating the other models, just the hydro.   Now it is.My electric rate doubled in the last year along with btc price going down. So I'm just running one as a space heater for now to offset oil furnace costs.(Edit) Silly old me.... was clicking the down arrow looking for other models. Nothing populated. Click in the text area and there it was.  Updating now Thanks again

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: Quote from: PopoJeff on December 21, 2022, 01:35:34 AMThanks for the information (both you above).  For some reason, that drop down box wasn't populating the other models, just the hydro.   Now it is.My electric rate doubled in the last year along with btc price going down. So I'm just running one as a space heater for now to offset oil furnace costs.(Edit) Silly old me.... was clicking the down arrow looking for other models. Nothing populated. Click in the text area and there it was.  Updating now Thanks again My 100th model is very quiet running on low.I will be testing it with:https://www.ebay.com/itm/285066554125https://www.ebay.com/itm/304119146264https://www.ebay.com/itm/203764567923

comments.author: mikeywith
comments.body: Quote from: philipma1957 on December 21, 2022, 01:45:29 AMhttps://www.ebay.com/itm/203764567923That's a fan simulator, are you planning on removing the 4 fans and just count on the external inline fan to cool the miner? seems like a good idea but the problem with this approach would be the possibility of over-cooling the miner when not needed, if the room temp is low the miner's software will lower the fan speed, you can't do that with an external fan, unless you get a smart fan which you can control with a temp sensor attached to the miner.

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: Quote from: mikeywith on December 21, 2022, 11:15:41 AMQuote from: philipma1957 on December 21, 2022, 01:45:29 AMhttps://www.ebay.com/itm/203764567923That's a fan simulator, are you planning on removing the 4 fans and just count on the external inline fan to cool the miner? seems like a good idea but the problem with this approach would be the possibility of over-cooling the miner when not needed, if the room temp is low the miner's software will lower the fan speed, you can't do that with an external fan, unless you get a smart fan which you can control with a temp sensor attached to the miner.yeah it is more for those that may want a super quiet miner in their garage.Today is pretty cold so stock fans are at 2700 and miner is cool in my garage.
